document_title: Acute appendicitis: Causes, signs and prevention
subsection_content:
Signs of acute appendicitis can easily be confused with other medical conditions, such as:
Urinary tract infection (UTI).; Gastric and duodenal ulcer; Cholecystitis, acute pancreatitis; Intestinal infections, diverticulitis; Right lower lobe lung inflammation; Women may be confused with gynecological diseases: Adnexitis, ruptured corpus luteum, torsion of ovarian cysts...; Children: Intussusception.; Elderly people: Intestinal obstruction, cecal tumor.
In addition, the exact location of appendicitis is different in each case, so it is difficult to distinguish. To make a clear diagnosis, doctors will often prescribe many different tests, including:
Physical examination of the abdomen.; Rectal examination; Blood test to determine the number of white blood cells, thereby helping to detect infection.; Diagnostic imaging tests: Abdominal ultrasound, CT scan, abdominal MRI.; Urine test, to rule out urinary tract infection.

viem ruot thua cap.json. Diagnosis of acute appendicitis
Signs of acute appendicitis can easily be confused with other medical conditions, such as:

In addition, the exact location of appendicitis is different in each case, so it is difficult to distinguish. To make a clear diagnosis, doctors will often prescribe many different tests, including:
Physical examination of the abdomen.; Rectal examination; Blood test to determine the number of white blood cells, thereby helping to detect infection.; Diagnostic imaging tests: Abdominal ultrasound, CT scan, abdominal MRI.; Urine test, to rule out urinary tract infection.
